instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP1V35_CAM: What is PP1V35_CAM? PP1V35_CAM is a 1.35v power rail to power the webcam. .
definitions.PP1V8_CAM: What is PP1V8_CAM? PP1V8_CAM is a 1.8v power rail for powering the webcam.

threads.title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
threads.message:
[B]USB port[/B] next to Card reader is working fine, but the USB on the LIO I/O is not working.
[LIST]
[*]i've already tried another flex cable and LIO I/O board.
[*]USB mouse, USB flash drive doesn't work.
[*]J9500 is very clean under the microscope
[/LIST] when i plug a usb device, osx will say "device is using too much power"

pin1 of usb port has 5.1v.
<SIGNAL>USB_PWN_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.3v



diode mode on J9500 :

pin 3 - 0.474
pin 36 - 0.434
pin 38 - 0.434
pin 42 - 0367
pin 44 - 0.365

these measurements are same as a known working board. so I don't know what else to check...


bad cpu??

threads.title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R1581</RESISTOR>.
Post diode mode to ground for <SIGNAL>XDP_USB_EXTB_OC_L</SIGNAL> signal.

threads.title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 46159"]Check <RESISTOR>R1581</RESISTOR>.
Post diode mode to ground for <SIGNAL>XDP_USB_EXTB_OC_L</SIGNAL> signal.[/QUOTE]

bingo! now I know for next time :)

[IMG type="full"]https://i.imgur.com/UrvN7R8.jpg[/IMG]

usb is working now.


----------------

threads.title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
threads.message:
forgot to mention, isight doesn't work. I've already tried aknown working display.

J4002 , pin12 has 5v,
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_CAM</SIGNAL> has 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> has 1.3v
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_CAM</SIGNAL> has 0v

<SIGNAL>PP1V2_CAM</SIGNAL> is shorted to gnd. i'am checking what is shorted. could be bad <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.

i'll need to remove L3901 to see where is the short.

threads.title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
threads.message:
i've removed L3901

short is on pin1 of L3901

threads.title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
threads.message: replaced <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> from a donor, isight is now back....took me almost 2 hours to reball this bga chip >.<

threads.title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
threads.message: Cap Locks light doesn't lit up, but button is working. is this part of trackpad?

threads.title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
threads.message: Amazing you replaced <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> that's something I'd never attempt lol good job! Caps lock light sounds like bad keyboard to me. Tried another keyboard?

threads.title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
threads.message:
lol thank you, this ain't my 1st time.
it's actually easy than it sounds. just reball and finding a working <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> from a donor takes a lot of time. 3 out of 4 <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> from donor boards were bad, i'll get a stencil for next time.


just tried another keyboard, the cap lock light still didn't work, then i tried another trackpad and it worked! thank god. i won't have to replace the keyboard

threads.title: 00165 - LIO's USB not working
threads.message: Nice yeah usually either keyboard or tpad in that case
